Armorclad.name: Armorclad
Armorclad.description:
You follow your deity’s will into places of danger, combining divine protection with sacred steel to protect you from all threats. 

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.gGXt1v9kDEr1PEac]{First Doctrine (1st)}: You’re trained in light, medium and heavy armor, simple weapons and martial weapons of your deity’s favored weapon group, and you gain the Shield Block general feat. If your deity’s weapon is simple, you gain the Deadly Simplicity cleric feat. At 13th level, if you gain the divine defense class feature, you also gain expert proficiency in light, medium and heavy armor. You may select Strength or Dexterity as your key ability score instead of Wisdom, but you still use your Wisdom modifier to determine your spell attack rolls and spell DCs.

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.39zibkG7ZpMWfquR]{Second Doctrine (3rd)}: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.vTUdzVvp2nsFDUqR]{Third Doctrine (7th)}: You gain expert proficiency with simple and martial weapons of your deity’s favored weapon group. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using your deity's favored weapon or a weapon from a single weapon group of your choice, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect; use your divine spell DC if necessary. 

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.AP0XfTB7QJO3oZZ7]{Fourth Doctrine (11th)}: Your proficiency ranks for divine spell attack rolls and spell DCs increase to expert.

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.2AjzxgxywXlT88FO]{Fifth Doctrine (15th)}: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

@UUID[Compendium.clerics.clerics-doctrines.ucDS0uR7A8FbCFh2]{Final Doctrine (19th)}: Your proficiency rank for divine spell attack rolls and spell DCs increases to master. Your unarmored, light, medium and heavy armor proficiency increases to master.

Fifth Doctrine (Armorclad).name: Fifth Doctrine (Armorclad)
Fifth Doctrine (Armorclad).description: Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to master. When you roll a success at a Fortitude save, you get a critical success instead.

Fifth Doctrine (Seeker).name: Fifth Doctrine (Seeker)
Fifth Doctrine (Seeker).description: Your proficiency rank in Perception increases to master. Your Perception DC to lie to you increases by 2 and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Sense Motive and to see through disguises.

Final Doctrine (Armorclad).name: Final Doctrine (Armorclad)
Final Doctrine (Armorclad).description: Your proficiency rank for divine spell attack rolls and spell DCs increases to master. Your unarmored, light, medium and heavy armor proficiency increases to master.

Final Doctrine (Seeker).name: Final Doctrine (Seeker)
Final Doctrine (Seeker).description: Your proficiency rank for your divine spell attack rolls and spell DCs increases to master. Your unarmored and light armor proficiency increases to master.

At 13th level, if you gain the divine defense class feature, you also gain expert proficiency in light, medium and heavy armor.

Second Doctrine (Seeker).name: Second Doctrine (Seeker)
Second Doctrine (Seeker).description: You gain the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.m0f2B7G9eaaTmhFL]{Devise a Stratagem} action; however, when you substitute its result for your attack roll, you can't use your Intelligence modifier in place of your Strength or Dexterity modifier. You can use your Devise a Stratagem with divine spell attack rolls as well as the designated weapons.

Seeker.name: Seeker
Seeker.description:
You are an agent of the church, tasked with seeking out the interests of your faith; lost knowledge, abandoned relics, enemies of your god and heretics within the flock itself.
